com.nwawsoft.util.natives

Class CharFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nwawsoft.util.natives.CharFunctions

  • public class CharFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Supplies functions for manipulating and working with the native data type 'char'.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      CharFunctions()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean isDigit(char c)
      Returns whether a specified character is a digit between 0 and 9.
      static boolean isLowerCaseLetter(char c)
      Returns whether a specified character is one of the 26 standard lower case letters from 'a' to 'z'.
      static boolean isNumeric(char c)
      Checks whether a specified character is either a digit from 0 to 9 or a '.' or ','.
      static boolean isSpecialCharacter(char c)
      Returns true, if the specified character is neither a lower case letter, an upper case letter or a digit.
      static boolean isUpperCaseLetter(char c)
      Returns whether a specified character is one of the 26 standard upper case letters from 'A' to 'Z'.

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric(char c)
        Checks whether a specified character is either a digit from 0 to 9 or a '.' or ','.
        Parameters:
        c - a char to check.
        Returns:
        true if c is a digit, dot or commma. Else false.

      • isLowerCaseLetter

        public static boolean isLowerCaseLetter(char c)
        Returns whether a specified character is one of the 26 standard lower case letters from 'a' to 'z'.
        Parameters:
        c - a char to check.
        Returns:
        true if c is a lower case letter. Else false.

      • isUpperCaseLetter

        public static boolean isUpperCaseLetter(char c)
        Returns whether a specified character is one of the 26 standard upper case letters from 'A' to 'Z'.
        Parameters:
        c - a char to check.
        Returns:
        true if c is a upper case letter. Else false.

      • isDigit

        public static boolean isDigit(char c)
        Returns whether a specified character is a digit between 0 and 9.
        Parameters:
        c - a char to check.
        Returns:
        true if c is a digit. Else false.

      • isSpecialCharacter

        public static boolean isSpecialCharacter(char c)
        Returns true, if the specified character is neither a lower case letter, an upper case letter or a digit. For more info
        Parameters:
        c - a char to check.
        Returns:
        true if c is neither an upper case or lower case letter or a digit. False if it is.
        See Also:
        @see isUpperCaseLetter @see isDigit
